subject: Steroids
lead_paragraph: Alexander Waldrop, the president of the National Thoroughbred Racing Association, has agreed to testify in front of a House panel investigating the effects of performance-enhancing drugs.Although most of the focus has been on baseball and other team sports, thoroughbred racing is also trying to enact a ban on performance-enhancing drugs, at least for the days leading up to races.Waldrop will join representatives from Major League Baseball, the N.F.L., the N.B.A. and the N.H.L., as well as college and high school officials, at a hearing of the House Energy and Commerce Committee’s panel on commerce, trade and consumer protection Feb. 27.
